value.description: If specified, indicates the SSL Context Service that is used to communicate with the remote server. If not specified, communications will not be encrypted
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The port on the remote server that is to be used when communicating with the DistributedMapCacheServer service
value.name: Server Port

value.description: The name of the server that is running the DistributedMapCacheServer service
value.name: Server Hostname

value.description: Specifies how long to wait when communicating with the remote server before determining that there is a communications failure if data cannot be sent or received
value.name: Communications Timeout

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the value used to identify duplicates; it is this value that is cached
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

value.description: If set, the cache value received will be put into an attribute of the FlowFile instead of a the content of theFlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.
value.name: Put Cache Value In Attribute

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to get the cached values.
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: If routing the cache value to an attribute of the FlowFile (by setting the "Put Cache Value in attribute" property), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.
value.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: The Character Set in which the cached value is encoded. This will only be used when routing to an attribute.
value.name: Character Set

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the cache key
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

allowableValues.description: Adds the specified entry to the cache, replacing any value that is currently set.
Adds the specified entry to the cache, if the key does not exist.

value.description: Determines how the cache is updated if the cache already contains the entry
value.name: Cache update strategy

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to cache flow files
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

value.description: The maximum amount of data to put into cache
value.name: Max cache entry size

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the value used to identify duplicates; it is this value that is cached
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

value.description: If set, the cache value received will be put into an attribute of the FlowFile instead of a the content of theFlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.
value.name: Put Cache Value In Attribute

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to get the cached values.
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: If routing the cache value to an attribute of the FlowFile (by setting the "Put Cache Value in attribute" property), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.
value.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: The Character Set in which the cached value is encoded. This will only be used when routing to an attribute.
value.name: Character Set

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

relationships.description: If unable to communicate with the cache or if the cache entry is evaluated to be blank, the FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: If a FlowFile's Cache Entry Identifier was not found in the cache, it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: not-found

relationships.description: If the cache was successfully communicated with it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the cache key
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

allowableValues.description: Adds the specified entry to the cache, replacing any value that is currently set.
Adds the specified entry to the cache, if the key does not exist.

value.description: Determines how the cache is updated if the cache already contains the entry
value.name: Cache update strategy

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to cache flow files
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

value.description: The maximum amount of data to put into cache
value.name: Max cache entry size

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be inserted into the cache will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully inserted into cache will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Whether to remove newlines at the end of each split file. This should be false if you intend to merge the split files later. If this is set to 'true' and a FlowFile is generated that contains only 'empty lines' (i.e., consists only of and characters), the FlowFile will not be emitted. Note, however, that if the Header Line Count is greater than 0, the resultant FlowFile will never be empty as it will consist of the header lines, so a FlowFile may be emitted that contians only the header lines.
value.name: Remove Trailing Newlines

value.description: The number of lines that should be considered part of the header; the header lines will be duplicated to all split files
value.name: Header Line Count

value.description: The number of lines that will be added to each split file (excluding the header, if the Header Line Count property is greater than 0).
value.name: Line Split Count

relationships.description: If a file cannot be split for some reason, the original file will be routed to this destination and nothing will be routed elsewhere
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original input file will be routed to this destination when it has been successfully split into 1 or more files
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: The split files will be routed to this destination when an input file is successfully split into 1 or more split files
relationships.name: splits

value.description: Regular Expression that specifies the names of attributes whose values will be matched against the terms in the dictionary
value.name: Attribute Pattern

value.description: A Regular Expression that will be applied to each line in the dictionary file. If the regular expression does not match the line, the line will not be included in the list of terms to search for. If a Matching Group is specified, only the portion of the term that matches that Matching Group will be used instead of the entire term. If not specified, all terms in the dictionary will be used and each term will consist of the text of the entire line in the file
value.name: Dictionary Filter Pattern

value.description: A new-line-delimited text file that includes the terms that should trigger a match. Empty lines are ignored.
value.name: Dictionary File

value.description: If set to All Must Match, then FlowFiles will be routed to 'matched' only if all specified attributes' values are found in the dictionary. If set to At Least 1 Must Match, FlowFiles will be routed to 'matched' if any attribute specified is found in the dictionary
value.name: Match Criteria

relationships.description: FlowFiles whose attributes are found in the dictionary will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles whose attributes are not found in the dictionary will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?U).
value.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?x).
value.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?u).
value.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding

value.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?s).
value.name: Enable DOTALL Mode

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the regular expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.
value.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence

value.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?i).
value.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching

value.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the begining or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).
value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters a given capture group value can have. Any characters beyond the max will be truncated.
value.name: Maximum Capture Group Length

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.
value.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.
value.name: Include Capture Group 0

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?U).
value.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?x).
value.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?u).
value.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding

value.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?s).
value.name: Enable DOTALL Mode

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the regular expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.
value.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence

value.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?i).
value.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching

value.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the begining or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).
value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters a given capture group value can have. Any characters beyond the max will be truncated.
value.name: Maximum Capture Group Length

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.
value.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.
value.name: Include Capture Group 0

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Whether to remove newlines at the end of each split file. This should be false if you intend to merge the split files later. If this is set to 'true' and a FlowFile is generated that contains only 'empty lines' (i.e., consists only of and characters), the FlowFile will not be emitted. Note, however, that if the Header Line Count is greater than 0, the resultant FlowFile will never be empty as it will consist of the header lines, so a FlowFile may be emitted that contians only the header lines.
value.name: Remove Trailing Newlines

value.description: The number of lines that should be considered part of the header; the header lines will be duplicated to all split files
value.name: Header Line Count

value.description: The number of lines that will be added to each split file (excluding the header, if the Header Line Count property is greater than 0).
value.name: Line Split Count

relationships.description: If a file cannot be split for some reason, the original file will be routed to this destination and nothing will be routed elsewhere
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original input file will be routed to this destination when it has been successfully split into 1 or more files
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: The split files will be routed to this destination when an input file is successfully split into 1 or more split files
relationships.name: splits
